intro: Pulicaria incisa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features linear, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small yellow flowers appear in clusters during the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Pulicaria incisa thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or arid environments.
